column4: ok who's a Samba guru :( I can't get it to work and I've read step-by-steps, docs, manuals, etc
still a no go
I have that link
that's what I was referring to
I appreciate that though, but I can't get it to work after reading the latter link
what does not work?
i've read that swat needs a lot of config, but first you need samba to work properly
can you connect to it from another computer?
first try to connect from the windows machines
have you set the same workgroup as the windows machines
is samba started 'sudo /etc/init.d/samba start'
yes
check this page for more about installing swat http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=58434
first make sure samba works and then worry about swat
now try one of your windows pc's
type hostname
nice, that means samba is running and working in some way
i think with windows clients it's best to have the same username and password as the windows user that is connecting
it's too
but i remember that that doesn't work all the time. I had problems with connect windows users and i only managed to get it running by using the exact user and pass
use sudo smbpasswd etc.
first maybe you should restart samba 'sudo /etc/init.d/samba restart'
